021import net.tnemc.core.currency.Currency;
022import net.tnemc.plugincore.PluginCore;
023import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.log.DebugLevel;
024
025import java.math.BigDecimal;
026import java.math.RoundingMode;
027import java.util.Collections;
028import java.util.HashMap;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.SortedMap;
031import java.util.TreeMap;
032import java.util.TreeSet;
033
034/**
035 * MonetaryCalculation
036 *
037 * @author creatorfromhell
038 * @since 0.1.2.0
039 */
040public class MonetaryCalculation {
041
042  private final TreeSet<BigDecimal> denominationTypes = new TreeSet<>(Collections.reverseOrder());
043  private final TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> inventoryMaterials = new TreeMap<>();
044
045  private final TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> toAdd = new TreeMap<>();
046  private final TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> toRemove = new TreeMap<>();
047
048  int attempt = 1;
049
050  public void initialize(final Currency currency, final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> inventoryMaterials) {
051
052    reset();
053
054    denominationTypes.addAll(currency.getDenominations().keySet());
055    this.inventoryMaterials.putAll(inventoryMaterials);
056  }
057
058  private void reset() {
059
060    attempt = 1;
061    denominationTypes.clear();
062    inventoryMaterials.clear();
063    toAdd.clear();
064    toRemove.clear();
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Calculates the amount of denominations needed to pay for a given amount. This method has the
069   * possibility of running twice. After the first attempt, if the amount can't be paid for then it
070   * will break down a larger denomination and sort through everything after the change is added
071   * into the mix.
072   *
073   * @param amount The amount to attempt to pay for.
074   */
075  public void calculateDenominationCounts(final BigDecimal amount) {
076
077    final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> result = new HashMap<>();
078
079    BigDecimal workingAmount = amount;
080
081    // Make a copy of the available denominations counts
082    final TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> counts = new TreeMap<>(inventoryMaterials);
083
084    final SortedMap<BigDecimal, Integer> lowerThanAmount = counts.headMap(amount, true);
085
086    // Iterate over denominations in descending order
087    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> entry : new TreeMap<>(lowerThanAmount).descendingMap().entrySet()) {
088
089      final BigDecimal denomination = entry.getKey();
090
091      // Calculate the maximum number of this denomination that can be used
092      final int maxCount = lowerThanAmount.get(denomination);
093      int count = workingAmount.divide(denomination, 0, RoundingMode.DOWN).intValue();
094      if(count > maxCount) {
095        count = maxCount;
096      }
097
098
099      PluginCore.log().debug("Working 1: " + workingAmount.toPlainString(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
100      PluginCore.log().debug("Denom: " + denomination.toPlainString(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
101      PluginCore.log().debug("maxCount: " + maxCount, DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
102      PluginCore.log().debug("count: " + count, DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
103
104      // Subtract the value of these denominations from the total amount
105      workingAmount = workingAmount.subtract(denomination.multiply(BigDecimal.valueOf(count)));
106
107      PluginCore.log().debug("Working 2: " + workingAmount.toPlainString(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
108
109      // Update the result map
110      if(count > 0) {
111        result.put(denomination, count);
112      }
113
114      if(workingAmount.compareTo(BigDecimal.ZERO) <= 0) {
115
116        PluginCore.log().debug("Working is zero break out", DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
117        break;
118      }
119    }
120
121
122    PluginCore.log().debug("Working 3: " + workingAmount.toPlainString(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
123    PluginCore.log().debug("Calculate comparison:" + workingAmount.compareTo(BigDecimal.ZERO), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
124
125    // If there is any amount left over, it was not possible to pay for the full amount
126    if(workingAmount.compareTo(BigDecimal.ZERO) > 0) {
127
128      if(attempt <= 1) {
129
130        final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> calculated = calculateBreakdowns(workingAmount);
131
132        combineMaps(inventoryMaterials, calculated);
133        combineMaps(toAdd, calculated);
134        combineMaps(toRemove, result);
135
136        attempt = 2;
137
138        calculateDenominationCounts(workingAmount);
139        return;
140      }
141      return;
142    }
143
144    combineMaps(toRemove, result);
145  }
146
147
148  public Map<BigDecimal, Integer> calculateBreakdowns(final BigDecimal amount) {
149
150    PluginCore.log().debug("calculateBreakdowns Amount:" + amount.toPlainString(), DebugLevel.DEVELOPER);
151
152
153    // Get the entry with the smallest key greater than the given amount
154    final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> higherEntry = inventoryMaterials.higherEntry(amount);
155
156    if(higherEntry == null) {
157      return new HashMap<>();
158    }
159
160    // Reduce the value associated with the higherEntry key by 1
161    if(toRemove.containsKey(higherEntry.getKey())) {
162      toRemove.put(higherEntry.getKey(), toRemove.get(higherEntry.getKey()) + 1);
163    } else {
164      toRemove.put(higherEntry.getKey(), 1);
165    }
166    // Calculate the difference between the higherEntry key and the given amount
167    final BigDecimal difference = higherEntry.getKey().subtract(amount);
168
169    // Create a new HashMap called counts with the breakdown of the original amount
170    final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> counts = new HashMap<>(breakdown(amount));
171
172    // Combine the counts map with the breakdown of the difference
173    combineMaps(counts, breakdown(difference));
174
175    // Return the counts map
176    return counts;
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Calculates the number of each denomination required to make up a given monetary amount, using a
181   * currency's denomination values.
182   *
183   * @param amount the monetary amount to break down into denominations
184   *
185   * @return a map of BigDecimal denominations and the number of each denomination required to make
186   * up the amount
187   */
188  public Map<BigDecimal, Integer> breakdown(final BigDecimal amount) {
189
190    // Create a new map to store the breakdown counts
191    final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> counts = new HashMap<>();
192
193    // Create a copy of the amount to work with
194    BigDecimal workingAmount = amount;
195
196    // Iterate through the available denominations in the denominationTypes list
197    for(final BigDecimal denomination : denominationTypes) {
198
199      // Calculate the number of this denomination required to make up the remaining amount
200      final int count = workingAmount.divide(denomination, 0, RoundingMode.DOWN).intValue();
201
202      // If any of this denomination are required, subtract their value from the working amount
203      // and add the count to the counts map
204      if(count > 0) {
205        workingAmount = workingAmount.subtract(denomination.multiply(BigDecimal.valueOf(count)));
206        counts.put(denomination, count);
207      }
208
209      // If we've made up the entire amount, exit the loop
210      if(workingAmount.compareTo(BigDecimal.ZERO) <= 0) break;
211    }
212    // Return the counts map
213    return counts;
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Combines two maps of BigDecimal keys and Integer values, adding the values of matching keys and
218   * adding new key-value pairs as necessary.
219   *
220   * @param exist the map to add values to
221   * @param toAdd the map containing the values to add
222   */
223  private void combineMaps(final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> exist, final Map<BigDecimal, Integer> toAdd) {
224
225
226    // Iterate through the toAdd map
227    for(final Map.Entry<BigDecimal, Integer> entry : toAdd.entrySet()) {
228
229      // If the exist map already contains the key from the current toAdd entry,
230      // add the value from the toAdd entry to the value in the exist map
231      if(exist.containsKey(entry.getKey())) {
232
233        exist.put(entry.getKey(), (exist.get(entry.getKey()) + entry.getValue()));
234
235      } else {
236
237        // Otherwise, add the new key-value pair to the exist map
238        exist.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
239      }
240    }
241  }
242
243  public TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> getToAdd() {
244
245    return toAdd;
246  }
247
248  public TreeMap<BigDecimal, Integer> getToRemove() {
249
250    return toRemove;
251  }
252}
